metadata.title: CVE-2012-2666 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
golang/go in 1.0.2 fixes all.bash on shared machines. dotest() insrc/pkg/debug/gosym/pclntab_test.go creates a temporary file withpredicable name and executes it as shell script.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.10 - 1.0.2
golang-1.10-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.10-src - 1.0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: golang: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.10 package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2').
